Reviews.Title: You won't believe what you get for your money!!!
Reviews.Author: Eggroll
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about buying this TV but went for it anyway.  I'm glad I did.  This is my first LED TV.  I was looking to replace my big-screen projection TV, but my budget didn't allow the size I needed.  So I figured I'd settle for this one with the intention of moving it into the bedroom later on.  I didn't need all the extra connections, and definitely didn't want a 3D TV.  This model seemed to provide what I needed.  I haven't been able to check out all of the features completely, so I'll update my review later.  But for now, it really is an awesome TV.Pros:- The picture is absolutely beautiful in HD. Almost life-like. Out of the box, it wasn't great.  I had to play with the settings to get it the way I wanted it.  I found it better to turn off the Clear Motion and just run it at 120hz with no software enhancements.  I have yet to find another type of viewing that would benefit from the 240hz.  But I haven't watched football or Nascar yet :)- Full LED; EnergyStar 5.0 - bet ya can't find that in a LCD or Plasma! $12/yr avg cost of energy :) Color, contrast, sharpness, etc., the picture is just... wow! Can't tell the difference between this 4,000,000:1 vs. 5,000,000:1 ratios. Blacks are dark, whites are bright; settings to adjust that too.- Sound: WOW! I expected crappy sound from tiny speakers, but man was I wrong! The sound setup has many different options. Sound Modes include: Standard (real good stereo but no effects), Amplified (what I use, like boosted stereo), Music (greater stereo sound with added bass and crisper treble), Movie (theater sound), & Clear Voice (mono?). Other options for speakers, sound effects, etc. I can't express how impressed I am with the sound from a 1" thick TV.- Internet Apps: Lots of choices for movies, music, social networking, etc. Basically the same ones the other mfgrs are offering. All easy to use.- Design: front panel controls are Touch sensitive, NO buttons!!! Love it! Remote: kinda large, but allows control of movies and Internet apps; intuitive, no need to read the manual.  Finish is beautiful; says it's a Rose-Black, but I don't see any color at all in it.  Looks deep black, high gloss to me.  Very thin, stand is sturdy or can mount TV panel on wall.  No connections coming out of the side of the TV (all in the back) reduces eye-sore clutter.- straightforward & intuitive; easy to work with and adjust settings. Tons of settings to tweak it just the way you want it.- when changing sources, it remembers the setting you had last with each particular mode so you don't always have to go in to change it every time.- view pics/vids from usb thumb drive / ext drive, wireless network connect to access shared media (movies, music, pics) from your computers.Cons:- No ethernet port to hard-wire. Need wifi dongle for internet apps.  On the upside, I got the Rosewill RNX-N1 dongle for $33 that works seamlessly and only costs half the price of Samsung's dongle. Software not necessary; just plug it in. I don't know if a USB Lan adapter (for ethernet port) will work with this TV; if anyone knows, please let us know :) Otherwise, the Rosewill works perfectly and all apps I've tried also work.  Rosewill gets its own review ;)- Limited connection ports: no optical for sound bar, but it's not needed anyway. Home theater can be ran through BluRay HDMI or Receiver component/composite.  Has 2 HDMI, 2 USB, 1 Component, 1 Composite, 1 mini jack.Overall, this TV was made for an excellent picture and sound with minimal fluff. And that's exactly what they achieved. Perfect for a small living room or a master bedroom. Hook up a BluRay player or laptop; that's all you really need. Just get the dongle for wifi and you're good to go! Highly recommend to anyone who's after picture/sound/price on the priority list ;)UPDATE:It's only been a few days, but I've been obsessed with playing around with all the settings! LOL So this what I've settled on for now. Understand that everyone has different preferences, so what I like is probably not what you like :)Turning OFF the Motion feature provides a crisper picture, clear defined lines, without blur.  When it's turned on, straight edges look jagged, blocked, and blurred.  I did turn it on while watching an HD football game yesterday and found that the Standard setting was better than Smooth (I turned it back off after the game was over).  It seems the more you turn it up, the blurrier it gets.  Although it may reduce and even eliminate judder, it's most definitely blurry. (Comcast Cable)For regular viewing, I use the following:Picture Mode - StandardBacklight - 14Contrast - 80Brightness - 51Auto Motion Plus - OffLED Motion Plus - OffThe different picture modes automatically change the other settings in order to "create" that particular mode.  It's kinda like a one-click solution for a fast setup instead of going in and changing up to 4-8 individual settings.I played around with a few other settings, but only made slight changes just to increase vibrancy/color saturation/warmth.  Like I said, you have to experiment to find what you like :)I changed the setting for DVD's to Dynamic picture mode.  Had to make some other adjustments once I did that, but I've had to tweak it for each movie I tested it on.I downloaded the AllShare software from Samsung and installed it on my desktop computer. The wifi router shows the TV on your network. I found if you place files in the program's default folders, it duplicates the files.  Much easier to just add (link) your already existing folders/locations.Hope this info helps :) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Kevin Francis McWilliams
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv last week and I am so very pleased with it.I chose this model for several reasons but one big one is that it is NOT 3D....not falling for that fad stuff!  I also run all my things through an AV receiver...which everyone should be doing already, so I didnt care if it even had speakers built in..just gonna mute em anyway. Only need one HDMI port, everything is funneled through the receiver again.  This tv is light. I was able to replace my bulky 720p 60 pounder with this 30 or so pounder using the same wall hanging mount ...BONUS! It's so thin it's almost too close to the wall now, so awesome!You will spend a bit making sure all your tv settings are right for the style of tv you watch...fast action movies and sports vs soap operas :P But once you get it right Man o Man. What a great buy.So for those of you not wanting a 3D fad tv, not needing 8 million inputs, not needing awesome high def speakers....this is your tv!

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: limelight "reachranj"
Reviews.Content: Good:1) Great picture, which is why I bought the TV. 240 refresh rate.Bad:1) While this is an internet connectable TV, you can ONLY do this with a wireless adapter, which you have to buy at additional cost. You cannot connect with a LAN cable as there is no LAN port on this TV. I was both surprised and disappointed with this. I bought an LG Blu-ray player, which came with a LAN port for internet apps and cost about the same as the wireless adapter for this TV.2) The remote is less than basic - you can't control your cable box or DVD player.3) Stand and overall quality/finish of the TV is not great. Even the screws to assemble to the stand were machined poorly and don't fit well. Stand does not rotate.4) Very limited Inputs and Outputs!Samsung really stripped everything out of this TV. They should have left the smart TV out as well and lowered the price point further. It doesn't feel like a high-end product at all, which is a shame because it could be a fantastic looking set if the finish were slightly better.I replaced a Toshiba TV with this one and that had many more bells and whistles for a similar price. LG have a 47" at a similar price point, which also seems to have many more features.Perhaps Samsung can ship everyone a better stand, wireless dongle and a better remote all for free!Will likely return this set and buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV! Exactly what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Clow Angel "my thoughts, my memories."
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Best Buy on Black Friday, and it's been a great investment so far. Right put of the box, it was beautiful: glossy, black, and thin. In my opinion, the quality's great. I made sure to check it over as I was setting it up.First things first, this TV came "Smart TV READY" meaning, it is capable of using wifi but doesn't have the adapter. It's really weird, I know, but that's what it means. So for those complaining about how it doesn't come with an adapter, well, you have to understand it has already warned you. You simply didn't understand the technical babble. If you're looking for a TV that comes with usable wifi, look for TVs that SAY 'wireless adapter included' or something similar.PROS:~ Picture. It has a Gorgeous--yes, capital G--display. Yes, it took some tweaking to get it just the way I want it, but it wasn't a difficult thing to do. A few adjustments here and there took only a few minutes. It also has a 240 refresh rate! I game a lot, and the amazing refresh rate makes everything look super smooth. I actually just set it to 120 for some of my less action-intense games, and it is absolutely breath-taking.~ Sound. Yeah, it isn't surround sound, but it sounds a lot better than most TVs I've seen.~ Easy set up. Seriously. This thing is LIGHT! I could pick it up with one arm. The stand and screws in my set fit perfectly. I know someone mentioned that theirs was a pretty bad fit. All I know is mine was more than just fine.~ Energy Saver! An average of $12 a year is phenomenal!CONS:~ It doesn't have many inputs and outputs, but that's not even a big deal. I have an input/output hub station thing for my entire entertainment system. I suggest people invest in one nowadays because no matter how many inputs and outputs your TV has, it's likely not enough for your entire entertainment system anyway! 5.1 surround sound, a couple of game systems, a laptop/desktop, your BluRay and/or DVD players, etc.. Not many TVs can fit all of that. And I'm sure many techies like me have even more crap they plug into their TVs.~ The remote. Yeah, it's absolutely SILLY, but the remote's really clunky and ugly. It's also pretty basic as someone else mentioned. It, however, CAN control your Samsung DVD player.As I play around with my TV more, I'll update this review if I find I have more things to add.

Reviews.Title: This is a great value for the feature set.
Reviews.Author: Francis D. Ferrall "Delphititan"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this set after seeing a special promotion by Samsung. It arrived from Amazon quickly and was easy to set up. The contrast is simply amazing compared to older TVs we have owned. We bought the USB network adapter. The WiFi capabilities add a lot to the practical use for using the  online experience if you haves group of people together and want to share the fun. I wasn't aware of what Samsung's "Smart TV" was all about, but it turns out to a be well implemented set of apps to access and use theinternet.I would recommend this set to anyone who is not wanting 3D as one of the features in their new TV. The lack of 3D is the only reason I gave a "4"rating.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money!
Reviews.Author: Josh m.
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about buying a "Used-Good" TV from amazon, but for the price of 514$/free shipping how could I lose? The shipping was a week by UPS. I was surprised to see it in the original box. First thing I did was inspect the tv and could not see the "cosmetic imperfections" that where stated on the description. Maybe they use a magnifying lens to see or I'm just not that picky. Even my girlfriend was like "you bought this used? Looks new." Second thing I did was plug it in..BAM.. POWERS ON! I popped in "Planet Earth" on blu-ray and enjoyed full HD 1080p! =0. I could not believe that I got this tv for such a great price! This is a wi-fi only "Smart tv" but my blu-ray player and apple tv are smarter than this TV.. pttth! I already own a 50" sammy plasma (GREAT!) and a 32" LCD (ok). This is my first  'edge-lit LED/LCD' and Im a bit disappointed that the corners are a bit brighter in darkest of scenes (cowboys and aliens, dark knight). My Plasma does not have this issue. Thats why I give the TV 4 stars instead of 5. (I give amazon 5/5) I think its the technology really. Full array/ Local dimming LEDs would not have this issue.Ok here are a few things I noticed about all three TV technologies (LED, LCD, Plasma). The lighting is only PART of the TV. Some people love Plasmas; others are diehard LED fans. Whatever. If the company is reputable with quality components and video processors, the tv is going to look GREAT no matter what lighting style you choose. LED is expensive, thin and bright but its darks are not the best. Plasma is cheaper with great blacks/natural color but the glass panel is reflective and can break. LCD's are durable and have darker blacks than edge-lit LEDs but not the level of plasma. IF you are going to choose a tv, remember that all three styles can produce a crystal clear picture. What you are paying for is the backlighting technology.Another thing is 720p vs 1080p;I have both. I own a newer 50" Samsung 720p plasma ($550) and this 46" 1080p Edge-lit LED/LCD ($514).-(Blu-rays)10Ft away = Both have same great picture.5ft away= 1080p still great picture, 720p begins to look grainy. (1080p looks grainy at 2ft away.)-(HD CABLE)10ft away= Both look the same (great)5ft away= Both begin to look grainy

Reviews.Title: WHAT A DEAL!
Reviews.Author: DAN
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this TV! The set up was child's play, and I had it up and running in less than 1/2 hour. WOW! The picture is amazing! I am replacing a ten year old Samsung HDTV (one with picture tube, monster weighs about 150 lbs!) I thought it had a great picture! But this new one is light years ahead of it! Yes, it only has two HDMI inputs, but that's perfect for me (cable and blueray)I had to buy a couple of cables, but found them on Amazon dirt cheap as well! Besides it does have a component input that would handle something else.The first thing I watched was TRON Legacy running through my sound system while playing the BlueRay! Really it looked better and sounded better than in the theatre! It was so crisp and clear, it made me a little dizzy! I simply wasn't used to seeing so much detail. I looked at hundreds(literally, at big box stores and local businesses)of TV's and Samsung came up on top for picture clarity and depth. When I saw the deal Amazon had on this set I jumped at it! No tax, free shipping, and I received it in less than a week! What more could you ask for? I'm a believer!There are TV's with more bells and whistles, but, for me, this one is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: John C. Davis
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality, and VERY thin.  Samsung does the thin-LED the best of all manufacturers, I think.  Limited connections in the back (going through an AV then to the HDMI is the best option) but much better than many other "black friday" or Holiday special TVs.  Wi-fi requires dongle or using a Samsung Wi-Fi DVD player.

Reviews.Title: Love!
Reviews.Author: Real Estate Diva "realestatediva"
Reviews.Content: This is our second Samsung TV that we bought on Amazon! We love buying from Amazon because it is usually lower priced than in Best Buy or anywhere else PLUS free shipping. Doesn't get better than that! Great TV, have had absolutely no problems with Samsung. We have the 55in. 8000 series and the 46in. 6000 series. The picture is fantastic. Very easy to hook up.

Reviews.Title: Basic TV with a Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Tabbymanx
Reviews.Content: I brought the TV two days ago and I found the TV itself isn't bad if you want something basic with good picture quality and a reasonable price. I agree with most of the pros and cons from other reviewers and thus am not going to elaborate here. I just want to add one con that is still bugging me. I am still not able to get the wireless to work. I have two other LED TVs at home and one is a big-sister 55" Samsung and I didn't have any problem connecting them. The network connection menu is more complicated on this unit. I first tried the auto-connect feature but didn't work and I subsequently tried all the other methods in the menu but still none of them worked. Perhaps it is not the problem of the TV itself but the experience has been frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!  Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Hoop
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV at Sears and love it!  It is so clear it looks fake sometimes!  Well coming from someone who finally made the purchase after waiting years to find the right TV and it turned out nice!  The options are less as far as the HDMI inputs and USBs compared to the 6000 but I don't need 4 inputs and really who does?  Point being we love it but its only been 4 days.  Football is all I watch and it looks perfect on DirecTV!

Reviews.Title: Its overall a good buy
Reviews.Author: cmukherjee
Reviews.Content: We received the Tv fairly quickly.i must say its a good deal if you dont care for extra slots behind the tv.The picture quality is superior to even the so called high end expensive tvs.It works for me.I am not a video game addict neither do i care for mind jolting audio features.Its a very good buy.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Got it as a gift for my brother and his wife for their wedding.  they love it, especially the smart features.

Reviews.Title: Cant go wrong with this TV
Reviews.Author: Arun Singh
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Amazing picture quality. No problems. Excellent for watching football! Blue Ray looks amazing on this TV as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: samsung
Reviews.Author: user
Reviews.Content: Its Working great so far. The processor seem to be slow I am not sure if its from the internet connection or from smart hub that I had to purchase separately.  The price was right at the time.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: rick
Reviews.Content: i bought this tv for my son , he cant stop thanking me,, says it is the most awesome tv he could ever want!!does have a beautiful picture. now i want one for myself!!

Reviews.Title: nice picture but a crackling noice and flickering of screen issue
Reviews.Author: melissa wrona
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv and thought wow what a great picture. clear as day loved it  then it started having this very loud crackling noise when we turned it on randomly, the pictures flickers off and on during shows it also has a quieter crackling sound randomly also.  We thought the tv was going to burn out and go black. Customer service has been no help.  picture good tv  not so much

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. I did have to buy a Samsung Linkstick for the 'Smart TV' to work  as it does not connect directly to a wired Internet connection.

Reviews.Title: samsung led tv
Reviews.Author: Elias Elias
Reviews.Content: had it around 3 weeks but so far pleased. the screen is glossy it reflects  a lot of ambient light even when lit but i like glossy screen and the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping- TV was in perfect condition. I would definitely do this deal again, no problems and I have had it for 2 months now

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6003
Reviews.Author: Weezzer
Reviews.Content: This is a great purchase! I don't need anymore than one hdmi input on a tv since i have a surround receiver with 4 so the 2 hdmi ports are fine. what i really wanted in purchasing this tv was a great picture and i got it! the colors are amazing! I poped in avatar on blueray and the blue hues gave me chills.pros- Great amazing LED picture- Great price for a 46inch LED- Very slim (Girlfriend was amazed)- sexy designcons- Really the only con i can see is that there is a little bit of light bleeding from the corners and a bit in the middle when the picture is black, but otherwise it is unnoticeable. But for the price, this is somewhat expected.ps. I don't notice a difference in picture and color quality between this and the UN46D6000.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: J. Arel
Reviews.Content: When I took the tv out of the box, I was amazed of how beautiful the screen was.  I still haven't adjusted anything on the tv.  I don't have anything negative to say about it.  I'm very pleased with my purchase.  FYI for people that like to view tv at night with head phones on.  Make sure that you purchase a head phone with volume control, because you will not be able to control the volume with the remote.  Also when you plug in the head phone to your tv, you'll notice that the sound is still coming out of the tv speakers.  You need to go to the tv menu and under sound, you need to change it from tv speakers to external speakers. Then you'll be good to go.

Reviews.Title: best tv ever
Reviews.Author: kevin shaun
Reviews.Content: Well long story short, we end up giving this tv to my parents for christmas they loved it and I can see why, the picture is immaculate,  especially when watching blu ray movie. Very thin which makes it like a picture on the wall.. definitely would recommend this tv to anyone, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this same TV in 40" last year and have been very please, however the 46" is even better! The color and clarity is outstanding. Everything about the transaction was excellent as the TV arrived much sooner than expected. My only disappointment with both TV's is the sound which lacks depth and sounds tinny. I have added a pair of Bose external speakers and now the sound is as good as the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great image quality...Strictly OK features
Reviews.Author: Sethiboy
Reviews.Content: Bought this off on Black Friday by not checking all the features of this product. I have to say I am enamored by the crisp image quality of the LED but highly disappointed with the additional features of this product. My mistake for not spending much time researching more about it. Only 2 HDMI outputs, No output to connect a computer (Via VGA)(Cant even connect my Mac), plus a more stressful way to hook up a Home Theatre system (Com' On Man!!)...I hate to say this but at this price point I should be getting all of the above...I am not too overly concerned about the non-availability of an Ehternet port but buying an extra wireless usb to connect to WIFI is just not my game...I am on the verge of returning this TV and spending a little extra to get all the above features...I would only recommend people to buy this TV if they want to watch plain simple television shows or movies that come on cable (But what is the point of an LED then buy a regular LCD and not waste an extra 100 bucks on this TV)

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46 LED
Reviews.Author: Giant Fan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture and color very special for all sports viewing.  The light weight and slim model make it very easy to install.  I feel the price is right for the quality received.  I recommend this TV for all sports fans.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Paul Hsu
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV if you did not want 3D TV. The picture quality was excellent and the price was great. The only bad thing about this TV was that it did not come with wifi adapter but you can get an after market network card (Rosewill RNX-N1) for around $20 which can be recognize by Samsung TV. Other than this, it's a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: TVwatcher
Reviews.Content: The UN46D6003 is my third HDTV and easily blows the others away.  The LED lighting gives an incredibly clear picture, which on certain scenes actually appears "too good to be real".  TV arrived on my porch in the manufacturer's box and was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality but limited apps.
Reviews.Author: Caymanseasider
Reviews.Content: Tv picture excellent. Sound ok although use home theatre. Not quite as  SMART as I expected. Think this model has limited Internet apps as I can,t seem to get Netflix etc. No real problem as I have apple tv. All in all great value for money and very pleased with HD picture quality.  Service from Amazon excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but a high quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: Scotty_DMan
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for about a month now and the picture is amazing.  But this is a no frills HDTV. It has an amazing picture with 240Hz, 1.2in thick, and is LED back-light, but that is about it.  It has no wifi(you have to buy the adaptor), a solid base that does not turn swivel or tilt, pretty basic menu, limited inputs.  This TV is a great deal if you are looking for just a basic HDTV with an amazing picture.  The only con I have for this TV is the speakers are pretty bad, I would not even plan on using them (but this is understandable because the TV is only 1.2 in thick I dont care what TV you get if it is that this the speakers are going to suck>)

Reviews.Title: Amazing LED TV.
Reviews.Author: Passera
Reviews.Content: I've had a Samsung LCD for about 2 years now and wanted to upgrade. I found this TV at a local Fred Meyer and they stillhad a couple left over from their Black Friday sale..That being said I purchased this TV for $699. How could I say no? Amazing upgrade. The HD picture is stunning, and crisp. I hate preset settings and truly believe you have to 'dial' in your TV, out of the box is Never a true or just judgement on a TV's capability. Excellent price, excellent TV.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE FOR PRICE!!!
Reviews.Author: J JAMES
Reviews.Content: Found the offer through Samsung and bought at Amazon.  All done in record time.  Easy installation.  Disappointed in the few hookups in the back--that was a surprise but got cheap cables, adapters, couplers from Amazon and they were here overnight for almost nothing.  NO MANUAL.  CAN'T PRINT 350 PAGES WITH ALL BLACK BACKGROUND!!  Have not needed the manual.  Everyone has given the picture quality 5 stars.  This model does have two speakers.  Disappointed that with SMART TV you can not do internet browsing. But we are overall 5 star happy.  Good apps.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price if you don't need a lot of HDMI outlets
Reviews.Author: C. Lorenz
Reviews.Content: Hands down Samsung is the best TV out there and for the money this is a great buy. I don't recommend it for someone that has a lot of components to add like sound bar, dvd player, playstation etc. I only use my Apple TV so I don't need a lot of HDMI outlets so it works for me. The stand for the tv is cheaply made but if you are going to mount it then it doesn't really matter. Overall I give this product 4 stars out of 5

Reviews.Title: Review of samsung HDTV
Reviews.Author: William Lynch
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set on Nov. 30,2011. It was due to be delivered on 12-9. Shipping was delayed by adverse weather and unit didn't arrive until 12-12 , a Monday. Tracking on the shipment left a lot to desired. UPS tracking seemed to be a few hours behind where the set actually was at all times. We waited  all day assuming that a purchase that cost this much would probably require a signature. We finally left at 6:00 pm figuring they had missed us. Unit was left on side porch without checking to see if we were home. It would have been easy for a passerby to give themselves a free Christmas present.Because of late arrival, didn't assemble unit until Tuesday. Unit requires 8 srews ( 2 sets of 4) to attach stand to the TV. Unit was missing 4 screws. Tried Lowe's and Home Depot to replace. No luck. Called Samsung's 800 service number. You would have thought I was asking for a new set. I asked the service rep to send all 8 screws since I didn't know which four were missing. He asked for everything but my shoe size and birth certificate, constantly putting me on hold for five or more minutes at a time. He finally agreed to send the screws in 3 to 5 busines days. The set could not be usd without these 4 lousy screws. I thought I talked him into overnighting the screws because he did say he would do that.Meanwhile I found a local company that dealt in hard to find screws and was able to find four that matched the missing ones. If you buy this set don't count on service for Samsung. Today is the 15th and still no replacement screws from them. So much for overnighting them. Set still wouldn't be running if I had waited for them. Because of this I plan to buy an extended warranty from someone else.Finally assembled the set. When you have all the parts the setup is easy. Obviously haven't had the set long but the picture is great. We checked in local stores before buying and liked the Samsung's picture best. There are some things I wished I had noticed before buying this set. This is a smart tv that is able to access the internet. However It doesn't come with an ethernet connection and the wireless LAN connector wasn't cheap. It has only two HDMI connections. I used 1 for my cable box and one for my DVD player. I hope I don't need to connect anything else. The set improves the quality of standard channels but it really sings in HD. I like the high def so much I sprang for an extra $5 a month on my cable to get the HD channels.It took quite awhile to download all the software for the smart tv but after that evcerything worked great. I gave it 3 stars mostly because of poor srevive from Samsung and the lack of sufficient connectors. If this is not a problem for you, this is a great set for the price, although I would suggest you consider a service contract from someone other than Samsung. If I keep getting the picture quality I am getting now, I'll have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Deal
Reviews.Author: gsigley
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for bedroom. So far it works great. We bought the 55 inch 3d led samsung last christmas and this 46 inch tv's picture is just as good. i think samsung has the best picture out of all the makes that we looked at.

Reviews.Title: Review centered on Football viewing and dealing with Samsung
Reviews.Author: R. Trimble
Reviews.Content: This review is based on my experience watching American Football, and my run-in with Samsung supportI watch football over the air antenna from local broadcast towers.  With the default settings, I found the artifacting moderate on close-ups.  I fixed this by dropping the judder and blur controls from 5 to 2 (turning them up only increased the artifacting.)  The only sacrifice I've seen is when a scrimmage happens and someone goes into movement, there's a bit of a "claymation" movement effect on the player in motion occasionally.  I suspect this has to do with the video processor's logic in handling portions of the screen where there is no active movement for <x> amount of time.  It probably prioritizes updating cells on the TV that have had movement recently.  It's not too distracting, though.  I might be able to tune my settings in better to eliminate it, but haven't figured it out yet.  Once the play is in motion, the TV keeps up to produce a flawless display of the action, so it's only a very minor thing that you "notice" , but doesn't distract from why you're watching the game.SAMSUNG Support:My TV was shipped without the "guide stand" which is the bracket that connects the TV to the stand.  I eventually got through to Samsung's "executive escalations" support, where I was told that my piece would be "expedited" to me.  They wouldn't confirm what the shipping would be, though (serious minus points here against Samsung.)  NOTE:  You have to send in proof of purchase to get a part shipped, and the people who review your submission of invoice aren't available through Samsung's support over the phone (different dept existing state-side.)  You have to wait for them to contact you.  I received a call within 24 hours confirming what I submitted was sufficient, but I was also already speaking to frontline support's managers at this point; might have had an impact.  You definitely have to push multiple times to get up the support levels at Samsung, and even when you do, they can't confirm how long it's going to take to get you your part.  The ballpark quoted before I got "expedited" shipping was 5-14 days (which, frankly, is unacceptable for a screw-up on their end.)To Samsung's credit, their chat support is easily accessible, as is their phone support.  I didn't have to wait for a rep, and their phone-tree doesn't prompt one to stab things.Great TV, and good luck dealing with Samsung if you have to.EDIT:  Turn judder up to 10 and keep blur at 2.  It's perfect on this tv

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Diane Theriault
Reviews.Content: Love this TV!!!!! I knew from the other reviews what to expect. Yes, the TV has limited ports, but the picture and sound override that. I set it up in less then 15 minutes, and found through adjustments what works well for me. I connected the LAN through my Samsung Blue Ray player, so I have internet. Overall, the set works for me because I only have 2 componets to hook up to the 2 HDMI ports. Maybe in the future I'll need a adapter, but until then I will just sit back and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Very Merry Christmas
Reviews.Author: KO
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I am the most knowledgable when it comes to TVs, but I am very happy with this purchase. It came via Amazon Prime in 3 days.  It was easy to install and the image quality is great.I keep it simple and haven't fiddled with the wireless internet yet.  However, so far, so good.  What a deal!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cavaliers R the best.
Reviews.Content: We love our new TV.  The picture is so clear and the on screen prompts are easy to follow.  We are older and all the new tech toys can be so complicated for us.  All we did was take it out of the box followed the directions on the booklet and then the on screen prompts and wala no frustrations, no panic just good TV.  I know we will enjoy for long long time.  We plan on mounting it to the wall.  Hope that goes as well. We have noticed the picture remains the same if the window blinds are open with plenty of light in the room or at night when the room is mostly dark.  We are happy we choose Samsung.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Vintage Rocker
Reviews.Content: The image quality is amazing and so crisp it seems like the images can be picked right off the screen. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: Soul Cinema
Reviews.Content: I bought this television to replace the 37" LCD LG in my den and even though I've only had it for a day I am very impressed.  Even my wife who could care less about watching television in Hi-Def or analog picture can finally see what all the fuss was is about. I only have two issues with the set:  I really want to take advantage of the Smart TV feature but I've already spent enough money on the TV to have to buy something extra.  Also I am having trouble with the Auto Motion feature.  I can't seem to find the right setting to get rid of the blur during quick motion.  Other than those two small complaints, I am very, very pleased with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This was my first large size flat screen replacing the classic "tube tv" and decided to choose the LED since that is where the technology is moving to.  Picture quality is truly outstanding. So incredibly clear. Setup was as easy as it comes.  Sound quality is excellent. I adjusted the sound setting to it changes with each channel since each challenge seems to have it's own sound level.  I only have to set the sound level to 10-12.  The 46 inch was actually perfect for my den which is 12' x 15", sitting 8 feet away and it's great.  Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Sound. Needs wireless adapter
Reviews.Author: Ashwin
Reviews.Content: The setup is easy, the picture is great, and the sound is excellent. The only negative is the smart tv feature which requires you to buy a wireless adapter. There is no LAN input.Would still recommend, because of the black friday deal and the great picture quality. Wish samsung would include the wireless adapter or a LAN input.

Reviews.Title: PHENOMENAL PICTURE!
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Kuelbs
Reviews.Content: I purchased the set as a personal Christmas "gift" to myself in December.  Up to that time I had been perfectly content with a 40" Samsung LCD HDTV (1080p) and friends told me there was little difference with the new LED screens.  But then I actually saw the new Samsung LED in person at a local store.  BOY WHERE MY FRIENDS WRONG! So I not only stepped up to LED, but increased my picture size to 46" and can now reliably state that LED is THE way to go ... and Samsung remains my favorite HDTV manufacturer ... while AMAZON remains the only place where I buy my electronics.  If there is a single drawback in the Samsung, it remains the tiny, tinny 10-watt built-in sound system.  You really need to augment their sound to get the full experience. But bottom line:  the picture quality is simply fantastic and you'll not beat Amazon's price (which includes FREE SHIPPING)!

Reviews.Title: Get an Aquos
Reviews.Author: KBPayton
Reviews.Content: I really just wanted something that I could just set up quick, a nice picture, great sound, and with as few bells and whistles as possible:Well....this is a fast set up, I guess....I share my neighbors wi-fi, and do not have cable or dish, so, all things considered, when the dongle actually worked well enough to pick up the wireless, than I could get a picture if I subscribed to one of the tv or movie apps...but the lag time for it to do this? It's like using an IBM and trying to sign onto AOL...at 5:30pm. Catch my drift? I almost thought about paying someone to just take it....However, for my purposes, this tv was the most cost effective buy I found, so I sucked it up, and kept trying. I went out and bought a Vizio Blueray, I needed a DVD player anyway, and the Vizio had a larger wi-fi pick up antenna attached. I by-passed the tv's dongle, and streamed Netflix via the Vizio....and when it works? It's freaking amazing, but when it doesn't, it really doesn't.... And it doesn't often....Still, I kept playing. I'm really not one of those people that like adjusting settings to get the picture I like with every use... I'll do it once and it better make everything look great from that point forward. I guess I really lucked out with my Sharp Aquos 26" LCD from like 5 years ago, because the picture was amazing, is amazing, no matter what's playing. And, neither is it contingent on the program running at HDMI, simple analog tv looks great on my sharp. Not so for this Samsung. HDMI programs that work, look beautiful, but a low res streaming program....forrrrrgggggeeeeetttttt it, save and buy an aquos. Despite this, packing this back up to pay for return shipping, wasn't something I was really excited about, so I kept it.I tried one of the earlier posts recommended settings and yes, he was right on with the motion plus stuff....that blocky blurry picture was making me want to pull my hair out. So thanks!The speakers on this are fantastic....thank God. It's probably why I kept it, because, I didn't want to pay for a whole new home theatre as living in an apartment building...one needs to pay extra attention to how much noise they make, and you can practically blow my walls down, they're so thin. So I'm very happy that the sound is so nice, with no tin can clanging echo-type sound that hurts to listen to.Would I recommend this to anyone? Maybe someone I didn't like. Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Ramesh Shankar
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the picture quality on this TV is very good. The sound is good too, but it definitely helps if you have external speakers. I have connected this TV to my Logitech computer speakers using the audio 3.5" minijack and the sound is excellent now.Definitely get the Rosewill wireless adapter for $30 or so. You can connect this TV to your wireless home network and run all the Samsung apps. The lack of an ethernet port is not a big minus in my book as I mostly use wireless networking for all devices now.I was initially using this TV as a dumb TV. It did not have a direct internet connection, but I was using my Panasonic BDT210 Bluray player to get to Netflix, Youtube etc. The Panasonic Viera Connect UI is excellent and I was quite happy. As the price of the Rosewill adapter is only $30 now, I decided to get the TV connected as well. So, I was able to compare Samsung apps with Panasonic apps. They are mostly similar, but two things stand out -* The Panasonic Youtube interface is much better than the Samsung one. You get preview screens and ability to scroll through pictures and choose the video you want to play with the Panasonic. The Samsung interface with much more primitive and difficult to use.* The killer app of the Samsung TV is the allshare application. This gives you the ability to connect the TV to your PC and stream music, videos and pictures from the PC. Allshare is a fantastic app - I am able to stream videos quickly and easily; what's more, it can play virtually any format video that I throw at it. My Panasonic bluray player also has the ability to connect to my PC, but it can only play some types of video and is relatively slower to load a video or to scroll through a directory of videos. Samsung has nailed this one.Other apps like Netflix, Cinema now etc. are more or less similar between Panasonic and Samsung. In short having connectivity for both devices is fun - each manufacturer is trying to put out more apps and you can have the best of both worlds.I think people who buy cheaper TVs based purely on hardware specs might be missing out on good software support - Samsung and Panasonic are at the top of the heap when it comes to apps and slick user interfaces.A few pointers -* Use 'makemkv' (google it) to convert DVDs and Blurays painlessly to MKV format which is now the industry standard video format for bluray players, TVs etc (almost all new players can play MKV).* The video played from the PC can be stopped/resumed. Fast forward, rewind does not work that well - you get to go a few seconds forward and back for each click, but it is better than nothing.* For streamed video, closed captions do not appear. But there is a workaround for this - you need to create a SRT file with the same name as the MKV file and store them in the same directory. Once you do that closed captions work. You can extract an SRT file from the MKV file using mkvmerge GUI app (google it), or you can download a readymade SRT file from allsubs.org.

Reviews.Title: Expected better software
Reviews.Author: RED STICK GUY "ReddStickGISguy"
Reviews.Content: The T.V. is pretty good. you might have garnered from other reviews that the outputs and inputs on the T.V. are pretty bare bones.The picture quality is pretty awesome. This is my second Samsung. The first one is a 4 year old 42" Plasma which has far more features than this one and in its prime cost $250 lesser than this T.V. Inflation maybe? Sound isn't as terrible as the other reviews led me to believe. It's pretty decent.I was able to get rid of a desktop that was connected to the T.V. in the living room...so YaaaY!The one thing that does bother me however is that more often than not, Samsung's "Smart TV" software is PAINFULLY unresponsive and takes its own sweet time to respond on the home screen. I am praying they really make it light on its feet. Come on Samsung! It's Linux not Windows! Make it more responsive.UPDATE: 01/12/2012It has been a little over a month now. The software problem is a little annoying, but I'm noticing a bigger problem with the TV. The audio lags the video quite a bit...randomly and never catches up...until you change the channel and come back to the channel. Strange! I searched and found that I'm not the only person having this issue and this Samsung model isn't the only model having this problem.People have wrongly assumed that the reason was that the AV input was the HDMI port, but that is not true in my case. It's normal cable.I will post an update as soon as I get a resolution for this.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had been able to review this set before buying
Reviews.Author: David A. Morrow
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy and Samsung 6000 or Sony 620 but settled on the 6003 because of Black Friday price. It is a very nice TV but not easy to adjust. No guides, no printed owner's manual with set, it is an e manual. So I'm happy with it but still don't have it quite adjusted the way I think it should be because of the issues listed above. Fuzzy picture on many sources, not as sharp as I had hoped. Inputs and outputs are very limited. I'm feeling I should've stuck to the 6000 or the Sony. Two previously proven sets.

Reviews.Title: Not ready for the Internet
Reviews.Author: RAAG
Reviews.Content: If you think that Smart TV Ready means that you can take this home and connect it to the Internet, guess again.  Turns out that it won't accept wired Internet at all and will only accept wireless Internet through the Samsung WiFi adapter which they'll be happy to sell you for another $60 or so.Perhaps you've got a USB wireless adapter sitting around that you'd like to use in one of the USB ports.  Nope.  Only the one sold by Samsung will work.  Or you'd like to use the Netgear WiFi adapter so that you at least spend your money on a generic device rather than a limited usefullness one from Samsung.  Nope.  That won't work either since it outputs to a wired ethernet RJ45 which this TV doesn't have.And don't expect this info to be easy to find in the literature.  An online chat with Samsung was needed to clarify that I needed to spend some more money.  "So sorry...Is there anything else I can help you with today?"  Not likely.Update:  Once you manage to get this TV connected to the Internet by means of the extra-cost Samsung WiFi Adapter, you'll find that it doesn't support Amazon's Instant Video.  For that you'll need to buy one of last year's Samsung models.From Amazon:"Note: At this time, Amazon Instant Video isn't available on 2011 Samsung TV or Blu-ray players. We're working with Samsung to enable this soon."Since last year's models had this capability, how hard can it be to make it available on this year's models?  Save yourself the fun of owning a TV that's headed backwards on the technologic timeline and buy some brand other than Samsung.And, BTW, it wouldn't hurt if Amazon would conspicuously disclose these issues with the Samsung TVs.

Reviews.Title: Screws do not fit the base
Reviews.Author: prettyyeyes386
Reviews.Content: Just got the TV and became frustrated when I could not set it up because the screws that come with the TV dont fit the TV.  You think they would have at least gotten that part right.  I am not sure if I will stay with this TV.-There is no Wifi out of the box-Not many input ports

Reviews.Title: Best TV EVER!
Reviews.Author: EpochTitan
Reviews.Content: Samsung has had an excellent track record with good quality products and this TV doesn't disappoint.  REAL LED, not that silly "LED Backlit" nonsense, and the sound quality is great.  I was considering buying a soundbar but the audio is excellent so that saves me at least $200.  This product is worth every penny!

ProductInfo.Features:
46-Inch LED Display
1080p resolution
5.0 Energy Star rating
Smart TV ready
Contrast Ratio: 4,000,000:1
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN46D6003 46-Inch 1080p LED HDTV - Black
